regulations.title: BeSmartAir TAKES CARE OF AIR PASSENGER'S RIGHTS

points.1description: We handle your case from the application submission to compensation payout.
points.2description: On your behalf, we submit all the necessary documents.
points.3description: Once you send us the documents online, we handle the rest.
points.4description: We are always in contact and at your disposal, informing you about the progress of the case.
points.5title: No costs for submitting the claim:
points.5description: No costs for submitting the claim. All legal fees are on us, and we charge a fee only when compensation is paid.

byYourself.title: CLAIMING AIRLINE COMPENSATION ON YOUR OWN

points.1description: Unclear information about the documentation required to submit the claim.
points.2description: Claiming your rights requires a lot of patience when dealing with airline customer service, and the entire process can take months.
points.3description: Managing the entire process yourself, including negotiations with the airlines.
points.4description: In case your claim is taken to court, you must count on costs regardless of the final outcome.
points.5description: Airlines rarely, if ever, inform customers about the progress of their case and its status.

whyUs.subheader: We specialize in solving problems related to airline flights professionally
whyUs.description: Our company specializes in obtaining compensation for our clients worldwide. We are not afraid of even the most complex and difficult cases. Client satisfaction with our services is our priority.

services.1description: Your flight was canceled at short notice? In addition to a refund, you are entitled to compensation of up to €600.
services.2description: In the event of a delay of more than 3 hours, find out if our specialists can secure compensation for you of up to €600.
services.3description: If you land with a 3-hour delay at your destination, you may also be entitled to compensation.
services.4description: Was your compensation claim rejected or ignored? We will verify the validity of your claim and apply pressure on the airline to hold them accountable.

compensation.title: We charge our fee only when you receive the compensation due to you
compensation.description: We calculate our fee based on the compensation we secure for you, so you bear no risk. Our fee is 20%

clients.awareness: Passengers are unaware of how big a problem delayed and canceled flights are on a global scale. BeSmartAir will take care of your rights and work to secure your compensation upon your request.

statistics.passengerClaims: Only 1 in 2 eligible passengers claims air compensation

clientFeedback.title: What our clients say about us

privacy.title: Know Your Rights
privacy.header: Passenger Rights Under EU Regulation 261/2004: Compensation for Delays and Cancellations
privacy.intro: Regulation (EC) No 261/2004 of the European Parliament and of the Council, also known as EU Regulation 261, governs air passenger rights in cases of delays, cancellations, or denied boarding. This legislation aims to protect travelers and guarantee them appropriate compensation in situations that disrupt their travel plans.
privacy.discussion: Below, we discuss how the regulation sets compensation rules, especially based on flight distance.
privacy.provisionsIntro: EU Regulation 261 grants passengers the right to compensation in cases of:
privacy.provisionCancellation: Flight cancellation – when the carrier cancels the flight.
privacy.provisionDelay: Flight delay – if the flight is delayed by more than 3 hours upon arrival at the destination.
privacy.provisionDeniedBoarding: Denied boarding – if passengers cannot board due to overbooking.
privacy.factorsIntro: These situations may entitle passengers to compensation. However, the amount depends on factors such as delay duration, flight distance, and specific circumstances of the incident.
privacy.ratesIntro: Under EU Regulation 261/2004, compensation for delayed, canceled, or denied flights is determined by the flight distance and length of delay. The compensation rates are:
privacy.factors: Passenger compensation may be reduced or not applicable if the airline proves that the delay or cancellation was caused by extraordinary circumstances, such as:
privacy.factorSafety: Safety issues (e.g., technical faults not caused by airline negligence).
privacy.processSteps: Passengers who experience delays, cancellations, or denied boarding may claim compensation if the conditions of the regulation are met. To claim compensation, passengers should:
privacy.processStep1: Submit a complaint to the airline – as soon as possible after the incident.
privacy.processStep2: Specify the relevant situation – e.g., delay over 3 hours, flight cancellation, etc.
privacy.processStep3: Keep documents – such as tickets, boarding passes, and correspondence with the airline.
privacy.refusalNote: If the airline refuses to compensate, passengers may contact the national consumer protection authority or seek assistance from organizations specializing in flight compensation claims.
privacy.summary: EU Regulation 261/2004 provides air passengers with protection in cases of delays, cancellations, or denied boarding. Compensation amounts range from €250 to €600 based on flight distance. Passengers have the right to compensation if specific conditions are met, though airlines may reduce or avoid payments if extraordinary circumstances occur. This regulation ensures consumer rights protection while maintaining a balance between airlines and passengers, allowing claims in unforeseen situations.

aboutUs.title: About Us
aboutUs.intro: Assistance in claiming compensation for delayed, canceled, or connecting flights

whoWeAre.heading: Who We Are?
whoWeAre.description: BeSmartAir is a leading company specializing in helping passengers claim compensation for delayed, canceled, or connecting flights. Our mission is to ensure that every passenger receives the compensation they deserve, no matter the situation.

expertise.heading: Our Expertise
expertise.description: Our team of aviation industry experts has many years of experience interpreting European legal regulations, including Regulation EC 261/2004, which protects passenger rights. This enables us to effectively represent our clients in negotiations with airlines.

service.heading: Our Service
service.description: At BeSmartAir, we offer comprehensive service – from case analysis and gathering the necessary documents to representing clients in proceedings before airlines. Our process is simple and transparent: clients can submit their claims online, and we will handle the rest.

whyUs.heading: Why Work With Us?
whyUs.description: By working with us, passengers can focus on their travels, confident that their rights are in good hands. Our company operates on a 'no win, no fee' basis, meaning you only pay if we succeed.

joinUs.heading: Join Us!
joinUs.description: Join the ranks of satisfied BeSmartAir clients and get your money back for unpleasant airline experiences!

step4.title: To proceed with your case, I need some information.

modal.pdfDescription: Replace with the path to your PDF

step5.title1: Each passenger in your reservation may be entitled to compensation of up to €600
step5.title2: You can submit a claim on behalf of all the people listed in your reservation. Did anyone travel with you?
step5.checkboxNo: No, no one traveled with me

step7.title: Enter your reservation number.
step7.reservationNumberInfoTitle: Where can I find my reservation number?
step7.reservationNumberInfo: The reservation number is an identifier for the booking generated by the airline. You can find it on your electronic ticket, booking confirmation, or any other document received after completing the flight reservation. It usually consists of 6 characters, including letters and numbers (e.g. DF87G#, REDYYD, L5W4NW). Be sure not to use spaces.

step8.title: Good news! It looks like you can claim up to €600 per person based on European Regulation EC 261. To receive the money you're entitled to, please sign below.

step8.signaturePrompt: Sign, save your signature and submit the form :)
